lexUnit.name: tendency.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an inclination towards a particular characteristic or type of behaviour

sentence.text: The second showed a definite tendency towards a masculine outlook within the whole tribe and the first showed what co-operation between the two sexes could achieve , with a more feminine outlook .
There is , indeed , an inherent tendency towards the development of paranota in various Arthropods ( e.g. the so-called pteromorphs of Oribatid mites discussed by Woodring , 1962 ) .
As size increases , there is a tendency towards greater depersonalization coupled with a decrease in lateral and vertical communication .

Developments in Tanzania in the mid 1970s were , however , to end in the direct contradiction of this injunction , a contradiction which is at the heart of Tanzania 's tendency towards an authoritarian state .

Nonetheless there is an underlying tendency towards equalization .
His tendency towards pleonasm had infected me .
He argued that there is an inexorable tendency towards the differentiation of things and that , as a result , societies become more differentiated .

Another common characteristic of global communications is the tendency towards excess capacity .

` I 've always had a deplorable tendency to exhibitionism , " Guy agreed , his deep voice full of laughter .

There is always a tendency for pilots to relax as the launch point is reached .
